column4: Ericjames: just incase the new one doesn't work you can roll back.
Ericjames: after uninstalling it you will need to run: sudo apt-get --purge autoremove ,to remove the modules
Ericjames: you will gain about 120Mb of space back too
Ericjames: if your current kernel is 100% fine then the other one is dead weight
Your call :)
Djrobbie: websearch a few of the lines, see what you find
Ericjames: you can but when a new kernel is added the change will be lost as grub.cfg is generated
!info webkitgtk
!grub2 | ericjames
Seanbrystone: create a pastebin of the text
well thats the entire error
ok im prolly doing it all wrong but i still get errors
nope i did sudo dpkg -l ttf-dejavu, it shows it's not installed
im not sure how to recreate the font, but i tried installing ttf-dejavu and ttf-dejavu-extra and it gets dependency errors
not sure what folder fonts go
does it edit HVDHC format?
ok ty
sudo apt-get -f install
you can just restore from your backups, you can also use foremost if you have failed to make any backups
yeah theres no backups, and what do you mean, "restore from your backups"?
you can run foremost in a livecd so the partition is not busy
if your data is important then you should have a backup system
I keep two backups actually (that i forgot about) sbackup and back in time, thanks for reminding me, i had a duh moment! :)
backups will always save the day :)
